ctrl

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • ctrl.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that manage the app. Used as an interface between the view and the "mechanic" of the application.
    Author:
    Cyril Fougeray

      Construcor of the controller.

    • Method Detail

      • startTFTPServer

        public boolean startTFTPServer(int port)
        Start or interrupt the thread which manage TFTP server
        Parameters:
        port - : port to start tftp server. port 69 is default but needs to have the application started as root.
        Returns:
        : false : server is interrupted true : server is running

      • getCurrentPort

        public int getCurrentPort()
        Get the port of the TFTP server currently started
        Returns:
        port of the tftp server started -1 if the server isn't started

      • getInterfaces

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getInterfaces()
        Get every connected interfaces
        Returns:
        Return a vector of every connected interfaces (link with the system must be physically done for eth).

      • setIp

        public void setIp(java.lang.String nic,
         java.lang.String ipServer,
         java.lang.String passwd)
        Set IP of the selected network interface card. The sudo password is required to execute this task.
        Parameters:
        nic - Network Interface Card
        ipServer - IP address
        passwd - Root password TODO Use a more secure way to execute this function because password is stored clearly in memory.

      • getPortList

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> getPortList()
        Get name of every serial ports available TODO this method don't list every serial ports
        Returns:
        portList : Vector of

      • setAndLoadTftpDir

        public java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> setAndLoadTftpDir(java.lang.String directory)
        Get a list of every files in the tftp directory if the tftp directory doesn't exist, it is created (if root) and set to be used as a tftp server directory else an empty vector is returned
        Parameters:
        directory - TFTP server path
        Returns:
        A list in a vector of directory file name. if 'files.size()' == 0, 'directory' doesn't exist otherwise, 'directory' exists but 'files' can return "No file available"
